Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 19 points in the third quarter to put the game away for good.
Edwards briefly exited to the locker room after appearing to twist his ankle, but quickly returned and immediately drilled a 3.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards said, 'I'm not like shocked or anything because I worked so hard for it,' referring to his hot shooting.
Rudy Gobert set the defensive tone early for the Wolves, recording all three of his blocks in the game's opening minutes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves scored the game's first 10 points and the Portland Trail Blazers missed their first 10 shots.
The Wolves opened the second quarter on an 11-2 run — Julius Randle scored eight of those points, including a pair of 3-pointers — and built a 27-point lead, their largest of the night.
Rob Dillingham finished with seven points on 3-for-3 shooting, two assists and three rebounds in six minutes, including his first career 3-pointer.
